      43             : class StyleAnimationValue {

      45             :   // Mathematical methods
      46             :   // --------------------
      47             :   /**
      48             :    * Adds |aCount| copies of |aValueToAdd| to |aDest|.  The result of this
      49             :    * addition is stored in aDest.
      50             :    *
      51             :    * Note that if |aCount| is 0, then |aDest| will be unchanged.  Also, if
      52             :    * this method fails, then |aDest| will be unchanged.
      53             :    *
      54             :    * @param aDest       The value to add to.
      55             :    * @param aValueToAdd The value to add.
      56             :    * @param aCount      The number of times to add aValueToAdd.
      57             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
      58             :    */
      59             :   static MOZ_MUST_USE bool
      60           0 :   Add(nsCSSPropertyID aProperty, StyleAnimationValue& aDest,
      61             :       const StyleAnimationValue& aValueToAdd, uint32_t aCount) {
      62           0 :     return AddWeighted(aProperty, 1.0, aDest, aCount, aValueToAdd, aDest);
      63             :   }
      64             : 
      65             :   /**
      66             :    * Alternative version of Add that reflects the naming used in Web Animations
      67             :    * and which returns the result using the return value.

      74             :   /**
      75             :    * Calculates a measure of 'distance' between two colors.
      76             :    *
      77             :    * @param aStartColor The start of the interval for which the distance
      78             :    *                    should be calculated.
      79             :    * @param aEndColor   The end of the interval for which the distance
      80             :    *                    should be calculated.
      81             :    * @return the result of the calculation.

      83             :   static double ComputeColorDistance(const css::RGBAColorData& aStartColor,
      84             :                                      const css::RGBAColorData& aEndColor);
      85             : 
      86             :   /**
      87             :    * Calculates a measure of 'distance' between two values.
      88             :    *
      89             :    * This measure of Distance is guaranteed to be proportional to
      90             :    * portions passed to Interpolate, Add, or AddWeighted.  However, for
      91             :    * some types of StyleAnimationValue it may not produce sensible results
      92             :    * for paced animation.
      93             :    *
      94             :    * If this method succeeds, the returned distance value is guaranteed to be
      95             :    * non-negative.
      96             :    *
      97             :    * @param aStartValue The start of the interval for which the distance
      98             :    *                    should be calculated.
      99             :    * @param aEndValue   The end of the interval for which the distance
     100             :    *                    should be calculated.
     101             :    * @param aStyleContext The style context to use for processing the
     102             :    *                      translate part of transforms.
     103             :    * @param aDistance   The result of the calculation.
     104             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
     105             :    */
     106             :   static MOZ_MUST_USE bool
     107             :   ComputeDistance(nsCSSPropertyID aProperty,
     108             :                   const StyleAnimationValue& aStartValue,
     109             :                   const StyleAnimationValue& aEndValue,
     110             :                   nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
     111             :                   double& aDistance);
     112             : 
     113             :   /**
     114             :    * Calculates an interpolated value that is the specified |aPortion| between
     115             :    * the two given values.
     116             :    *
     117             :    * This really just does the following calculation:
     118             :    *   aResultValue = (1.0 - aPortion) * aStartValue + aPortion * aEndValue
     119             :    *
     120             :    * @param aStartValue The value defining the start of the interval of
     121             :    *                    interpolation.
     122             :    * @param aEndValue   The value defining the end of the interval of
     123             :    *                    interpolation.
     124             :    * @param aPortion    A number in the range [0.0, 1.0] defining the
     125             :    *                    distance of the interpolated value in the interval.
     126             :    * @param [out] aResultValue The resulting interpolated value.
     127             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
     128             :    */
     129             :   static MOZ_MUST_USE bool
     130           0 :   Interpolate(nsCSSPropertyID aProperty,
     131             :               const StyleAnimationValue& aStartValue,
     132             :               const StyleAnimationValue& aEndValue,
     133             :               double aPortion,
     134             :               StyleAnimationValue& aResultValue) {
     135             :     return AddWeighted(aProperty, 1.0 - aPortion, aStartValue,
     136           0 :                        aPortion, aEndValue, aResultValue);
     137             :   }
     138             : 
     139             :   /**
     140             :    * Does the calculation:
     141             :    *   aResultValue = aCoeff1 * aValue1 + aCoeff2 * aValue2
     142             :    *
     143             :    * @param [out] aResultValue The resulting interpolated value.  May be
     144             :    *                           the same as aValue1 or aValue2.
     145             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
     146             :    *
     147             :    * NOTE: Current callers always pass aCoeff1 and aCoeff2 >= 0.  They
     148             :    * are currently permitted to be negative; however, if, as we add
     149             :    * support more value types types, we find that this causes
     150             :    * difficulty, we might change this to restrict them to being
     151             :    * positive.
     152             :    */
     153             :   static MOZ_MUST_USE bool
     154             :   AddWeighted(nsCSSPropertyID aProperty,
     155             :               double aCoeff1, const StyleAnimationValue& aValue1,
     156             :               double aCoeff2, const StyleAnimationValue& aValue2,
     157             :               StyleAnimationValue& aResultValue);
     158             : 
     159             :   /**
     160             :    * Accumulates |aA| onto |aA| (|aCount| - 1) times then accumulates |aB| onto
     161             :    * the result.
     162             :    * If |aCount| is zero or no accumulation or addition procedure is defined
     163             :    * for |aProperty|, the result will be |aB|.

     170             : 
     171             :   // Type-conversion methods
     172             :   // -----------------------
     173             :   /**
     174             :    * Creates a computed value for the given specified value
     175             :    * (property ID + string).  A style context is needed in case the
     176             :    * specified value depends on inherited style or on the values of other
     177             :    * properties.
     178             :    *
     179             :    * @param aProperty       The property whose value we're computing.
     180             :    * @param aTargetElement  The content node to which our computed value is
     181             :    *                        applicable. For pseudo-elements, this is the parent
     182             :    *                        element to which the pseudo is attached, not the
     183             :    *                        generated content node.
     184             :    * @param aStyleContext   The style context used to compute values from the
     185             :    *                        specified value. For pseudo-elements, this should
     186             :    *                        be the style context corresponding to the pseudo
     187             :    *                        element.
     188             :    * @param aSpecifiedValue The specified value, from which we'll build our
     189             :    *                        computed value.
     190             :    * @param aUseSVGMode     A flag to indicate whether we should parse
     191             :    *                        |aSpecifiedValue| in SVG mode.
     192             :    * @param [out] aComputedValue The resulting computed value.
     193             :    * @param [out] aIsContextSensitive
     194             :    *                        Set to true if |aSpecifiedValue| may produce
     195             :    *                        a different |aComputedValue| depending on other CSS
     196             :    *                        properties on |aTargetElement| or its ancestors.
     197             :    *                        false otherwise.
     198             :    *                        Note that the operation of this method is
     199             :    *                        significantly faster when |aIsContextSensitive| is
     200             :    *                        nullptr.
     201             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
     202             :    */
     203             :   static MOZ_MUST_USE bool
     204             :   ComputeValue(nsCSSPropertyID aProperty,
     205             :                mozilla::dom::Element* aTargetElement,
     206             :                nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,

     208             :                bool aUseSVGMode,
     209             :                StyleAnimationValue& aComputedValue,

     211             : 
     212             :   /**
     213             :    * Like ComputeValue, but returns an array of StyleAnimationValues.
     214             :    *
     215             :    * On success, when aProperty is a longhand, aResult will have a single
     216             :    * value in it.  When aProperty is a shorthand, aResult will be filled with
     217             :    * values for all of aProperty's longhand components.  aEnabledState
     218             :    * is used to filter the longhand components that will be appended
     219             :    * to aResult.  On failure, aResult might still have partial results
     220             :    * in it.

     244             :   /**
     245             :    * Creates a specified value for the given computed value.
     246             :    *
     247             :    * The first two overloads fill in an nsCSSValue object; the third
     248             :    * produces a string.  For the overload that takes a const
     249             :    * StyleAnimationValue& reference, the nsCSSValue result may depend on
     250             :    * objects owned by the |aComputedValue| object, so users of that variant
     251             :    * must keep |aComputedValue| alive longer than |aSpecifiedValue|.
     252             :    * The overload that takes an rvalue StyleAnimationValue reference
     253             :    * transfers ownership for some resources such that the |aComputedValue|
     254             :    * does not depend on the lifetime of |aSpecifiedValue|.
     255             :    *
     256             :    * @param aProperty      The property whose value we're uncomputing.
     257             :    * @param aComputedValue The computed value to be converted.
     258             :    * @param [out] aSpecifiedValue The resulting specified value.
     259             :    * @return true on success, false on failure.
     260             :    */

     276             :    * context.
     277             :    *
     278             :    * Obtaining the computed value allows us to animate properties when the
     279             :    * content author has specified a value like "inherit" or "initial" or some

     297             :   /**
     298             :    * The types and values for the values that we extract and animate.
     299             :    */
     300             :   enum Unit {
     301             :     eUnit_Null, // not initialized
     302             :     eUnit_Normal,
     303             :     eUnit_Auto,
     304             :     eUnit_None,
     305             :     eUnit_Enumerated,
     306             :     eUnit_Visibility, // special case for transitions (which converts
     307             :                       // Enumerated to Visibility as needed)
     308             :     eUnit_Integer,
     309             :     eUnit_Coord,
     310             :     eUnit_Percent,
     311             :     eUnit_Float,
     312             :     eUnit_Color, // nsCSSValue* (never null), always with an nscolor or
     313             :                  // an nsCSSValueFloatColor
     314             :     eUnit_CurrentColor,
     315             :     eUnit_ComplexColor, // ComplexColorValue* (never null)
     316             :     eUnit_Calc, // nsCSSValue* (never null), always with a single
     317             :                 // calc() expression that's either length or length+percent
     318             :     eUnit_ObjectPosition, // nsCSSValue* (never null), always with a
     319             :                           // 4-entry nsCSSValue::Array
     320             :     eUnit_URL, // nsCSSValue* (never null), always with a css::URLValue
     321             :     eUnit_DiscreteCSSValue, // nsCSSValue* (never null)
     322             :     eUnit_CSSValuePair, // nsCSSValuePair* (never null)
     323             :     eUnit_CSSValueTriplet, // nsCSSValueTriplet* (never null)
     324             :     eUnit_CSSRect, // nsCSSRect* (never null)
     325             :     eUnit_Dasharray, // nsCSSValueList* (never null)
     326             :     eUnit_Shadow, // nsCSSValueList* (may be null)
     327             :     eUnit_Shape,  // nsCSSValue::Array* (never null)
     328             :     eUnit_Filter, // nsCSSValueList* (may be null)
     329             :     eUnit_Transform, // nsCSSValueList* (never null)
     330             :     eUnit_BackgroundPositionCoord, // nsCSSValueList* (never null)
     331             :     eUnit_CSSValuePairList, // nsCSSValuePairList* (never null)
     332             :     eUnit_UnparsedString // nsStringBuffer* (never null)
